author: Pratham Nagpal
content: The cofounder and ousted chief business officer (CBO) of cryptocurrency trading platform LetsKrypto, Vaibhav Shukla, has moved the NCLT against the cofounders of cryptocurrency trading platform Brine.fi and investor Elevation Capital, accusing them of stealing and syphoning off key assets, including cryptocurrencies, user data and intellectual property, of parent Inventphile Ventures Pvt Ltd.
title: Brine.fi founders, Elevation Capital in dock over NCLT petition

author: Kanishk
content: The month of February turned out to be positive for the Indian startup ecosystem as venture capital funding rose by 21% due to the steady inflow of deals. The total VC funding stood at $890 million, cutting across 114 deals. The month of February witnessed most large deals with a ticket size in the range of $20-40 million.
title: Venture capital funding in February rises by 21% YoY

author: Vivek
content: Specialty coffee brand abCoffee has raised $3.4 million in a Series A funding round led by Nexus Venture Partners. Tanglin Venture Partners, an existing investor, also participated. The startup plans to use the raised capital to enhance its supply chain and technological advancements, with the ultimate goal of delivering on-demand coffee more efficiently and affordably.
title: Specialty coffee brand abCoffee raises $3.4 million in funding

author: Vivek
content: Mumbai-based direct-to-consumer (DC) skincare brand Foxtale has raised approximately $14 million in a new funding round led by Singapore-based Panthera Growth Partners. The startup offers a range of products, from moisturizers to serums. It competes with established names like Sugar Cosmetics, WOW Skin Science, and MamaEarth.
title: Mumbai-based skincare brand Foxtale raises $14 million in funding

author: Vivek
content: MyGate, a Bengaluru-based community management app, has announced an ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) buyback program for over 50 employees across all roles and business verticals. The move comes as a token of appreciation for employees who have dedicated over four years to the company, allowing them to cash out 20% of their vested shares.
title: Bengaluru-based MyGate announces ESOP buyback for 50+ employees

author: Rashaad
content: After co-founding Gavin Paris, 27-YO shark tank fame Ashutosh Roy, hailing from a small village in Bihar, launched his apparel brand, Offmint. In partnership with London-based designer Rani Ahluwalia, Offmint focuses on quality, sustainability, and empowering women. Within a month, it started generating ₹1 lakh daily revenue and is now gearing up for global expansion.
title: 27-year-old receives ₹83 crore funding for apparel business

author: Kanishk
content: Alternative financing fintech platform GetVantage has launched Rise-Up Fund with an initial corpus of Rs 100 crore to support over 400 women-led businesses and enable them to scale up within the next 12 months. The platform plans to distribute funds through its NBFC GetGrowth Capital and Varanium's Debt Fund partnership, alongside other NBFCs and AIFs.
title: GetVantage announces Rs 100 Cr fund for women entrepreneurs

author: Ashley Paul
content: OpenAI CTO Mira Murati, who took over as interim CEO following Sam Altman's ouster, played a key role in the chief executive's removal, The New York Times reported. Murati questioned Altman's management in a memo to him and shared her concerns with OpenAI's board, which later ousted him. She also claimed that Altman sometimes created a toxic work environment.
title: OpenAI CTO Mira Murati played key role in Altman's ouster: Report

author: Ashley Paul
content: BharatPe ex-MD Ashneer Grover has urged Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) to stop its "wild-goose chase" against him, Moneycontrol reported citing his letter to EOW officials. Ashneer said EOW's investigation on BharatPe's complaint could be "one-sided" and "non-compliant" with due procedures. He wrote the letters after EOW declined to remove a lookout circular against him and his wife.
title: Ashneer alleges 'wild-goose chase' by Delhi Police in BharatPe case: Report

author: Pratham Nagpal
content: D2C innerwear startup Bummer has raised INR 9.25 Cr ($1.1 Mn) in its pre-Series A1 funding round led by Gruhas Collective Consumer Fund. The round also saw participation from existing investor Fluid Ventures. The startup aims to use the fresh proceeds to fuel its expansion by bolstering its omnichannel presence.
title: Bummer bags funding from Nikhil Kamath's Gruhas
